summary: The class models a single‑qubit phase rotation about the Z axis, represented by a diagonal 2×2 matrix with entries (1, e^{iλ}). It can be realized virtually as a frame change, incurring no physical error or duration. Although functionally equivalent to a Z‑rotation (RZ) up to a global phase, the gate is deprecated in favor of the explicit phase gate or a generic U‑gate with zero X/Y components.
business_intent: Offer a convenient abstraction for applying a virtual Z‑axis phase shift within quantum circuits, enabling zero‑cost rotations while maintaining compatibility with legacy Qiskit code, but guide users toward the newer phase‑gate implementation.
